intro: Boopis miersii, commonly known as Miers' boopis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Boopis miersii is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
